unnormalised: Planning a trip and stressing about addresses? Don't worry, *yaar*, I got you covered! When booking hotels online, I always double-check the address on Google Maps. Last time I booked "Hotel Paradise, Near Railway Station, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302006", turns out "Near" was actually 3 km away! Major *lolfail*.
normalised: Planning a trip and stressing about addresses? Don't worry, yaar, I got you covered! When booking hotels online, I always double-check the address on Google Maps. Last time I booked "Hotel Paradise, Near Railway Station, Jaipur, Rajasthan three hundred and two thousand and six", turns out "Near" was actually three kilometer away! Major lolfail.

unnormalised: Also, remember those pesky booking confirmations? They're loaded with address deets! The hotel address, sometimes the travel agency's address like "MakeMyTrip, DLF Building 8, Gurgaon, Haryana 122002", plus billing addresses. Keep 'em handy, especially if you're asking for directions from your *auto-walla*! They need the exact "Landmark"

unnormalised: Speaking of exact, my pro tip: Always copy-paste the address! Typos happen. I once sent a gift to "22 B Baker Street, Kolkata, West Bengal 700001" instead of "22/B….". Turns out, that little slash makes a huge difference, lol. The poor delivery guy!
normalised: Speaking of exact, my pro tip: Always copy-paste the address! Typos happen. I once sent a gift to "twenty two B Baker Street, Kolkata, West Bengal seven hundred thousand and one" instead of "twenty two slash B….". Turns out, that little slash makes a huge difference, lol. The poor delivery guy!

unnormalised: Pro-tip when you arrive, ask the hotel staff to write down the hotel address and landmark in the local language. So if you need to ask your *rickshaw-walla* to take you to your hotel, you can just show them! Imagine trying to pronounce "Shanti Niketan Guest House, Sector 17, Chandigarh, 160017" in Punjabi!

unnormalised: Ultimately, booking travel should be relaxing, not stressful. A little prep work with addresses and a dash of humor will save you tons of time! Happy travels, friends! Don't forget your *chai*!
